# Invitation to Qualify - Accessibility Project - Phase 1

## Project Overview

Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC), on behalf of the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA), is seeking bids for the Phase 1 of a two-phase project to renovate the interior space at the CFIA laboratory located at 3155 Willingdon Green, Burnaby, British Columbia. This project is part of CFIA's Accessibility Project aimed at meeting the accessibility requirements of the Accessible Canada Act (ACA).

## Tender Details

* Tender Reference Number: WS4378330224
* Amendment Number: 1
* Solicitation Number: WS4378330224
* Publication Date: January 4, 2024
* Tender Closing Date: January 22, 2024 at 2:00 PM (PST)
* Procurement Category: Construction and Infrastructure
* Trade Agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

## Background and Requirements

The project involves renovating office spaces to meet accessibility standards. The objective of Phase 1 is to evaluate the qualifications of proponents, including their experience and ability to meet the project requirements.

## Evaluation Criteria

Proponents competing for the Phase 1 prize will be evaluated based on their qualifications, experience, and ability to meet the project requirements.

## Competitive Bidding Process

This is an open and competitive bid process. PSPC, on behalf of the CFIA, reserves the right to select the best possible supplier based on their qualifications, price, and other relevant factors.

## Instructions to Bidders

Only proponents who have been prequalified will be invited to submit a financial bid in Phase 2. Proponents are required to submit a bid package with their application.

## Contract Description

The successful contractor must execute a contract with PSPC on behalf of the CFIA. The contract will include all terms and conditions regarding payment, timeline, and deliverables.
